## Florida Amendment 1, Partisan School Board Elections Amendment (2024)

“PARTISAN ELECTION OF MEMBERS OF DISTRICT SCHOOL BOARDS.— Proposing amendments to the State Constitution to require members of a district school board to be elected in a partisan election rather than a nonpartisan election and to specify that the amendment only applies to elections held on or after the November 2026 general election. However, partisan primary elections may occur before the 2026 general election for purposes of nominating political party candidates to that office for placement on the 2026 general election ballot.[3]”
## Florida Amendment 2, Right to Hunt and Fish Amendment (2024)
## Florida Amendment 4, Right to Abortion Initiative (2024)
“Amendment to Limit Government Interference with Abortion[6]”
## Florida Amendment 5, Annual Inflation Adjustment for Homestead Property Tax Exemption Value Amendment (2024)
“ANNUAL ADJUSTMENTS TO THE VALUE OF CERTAIN HOMESTEAD EXEMPTIONS.[4]”
## Florida Amendment 6, Repeal of Public Financing for Statewide Campaigns Amendment (2024)
## Hillsborough County, Florida, Referendum 1, Community Investment Half-Cent Sales Tax Renewal Measure (November 2024)

“Shall Hillsborough County renew the existing local government infrastructure surtax, known locally as the community investment half-cent sales tax, commencing December 1, 2026, through December 31, 2041, to be shared with the municipalities and the School Board to fund infrastructure for transportation and public works, public safety, public facilities, public utilities and public schools?”
## Hillsborough County, Florida, Referendum 2, School District Tax Levy Measure (November 2024)

“To provide educational excellence for student learning by ensuring competitive salaries to retain and recruit high quality teachers and staff, implementing and preserving academic programs, and distributing proportional funds pursuant to Florida law with charter schools, shall the School District of Hillsborough County levy an ad valorem operating millage of one mill annually from July 1, 2025 through June 30, 2029, with annual reporting to county residents for transparency of the use of funds?”
## Tampa, Florida, Remove Residency Requirements for Non-Elected City Officers Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the amendment to section 6.01 of the Tampa Charter, revising the residency requirements for the officers of the city who conduct the government to apply only to elected officers, as set out and proposed by City of Tampa Ordinance No. 2024-59, be ratified and approved?”

## Florida Thirteenth Judicial Circuit State Attorney
## Hillsborough County Board of Commissioners District 6 At-large
## Hillsborough County Clerk of Court and Comptroller
## Hillsborough County Public Schools Board of Education District 7 At-large
## Hillsborough Soil and Water Conservation District Seat 4
## Florida Amendment 1, Partisan School Board Elections Amendment (2024)

“PARTISAN ELECTION OF MEMBERS OF DISTRICT SCHOOL BOARDS.— Proposing amendments to the State Constitution to require members of a district school board to be elected in a partisan election rather than a nonpartisan election and to specify that the amendment only applies to elections held on or after the November 2026 general election. However, partisan primary elections may occur before the 2026 general election for purposes of nominating political party candidates to that office for placement on the 2026 general election ballot.[3]”
## Florida Amendment 2, Right to Hunt and Fish Amendment (2024)
## Florida Amendment 4, Right to Abortion Initiative (2024)
“Amendment to Limit Government Interference with Abortion[6]”
## Florida Amendment 5, Annual Inflation Adjustment for Homestead Property Tax Exemption Value Amendment (2024)
“ANNUAL ADJUSTMENTS TO THE VALUE OF CERTAIN HOMESTEAD EXEMPTIONS.[4]”
## Florida Amendment 6, Repeal of Public Financing for Statewide Campaigns Amendment (2024)
## Hillsborough County, Florida, Referendum 1, Community Investment Half-Cent Sales Tax Renewal Measure (November 2024)

“Shall Hillsborough County renew the existing local government infrastructure surtax, known locally as the community investment half-cent sales tax, commencing December 1, 2026, through December 31, 2041, to be shared with the municipalities and the School Board to fund infrastructure for transportation and public works, public safety, public facilities, public utilities and public schools?”
## Hillsborough County, Florida, Referendum 2, School District Tax Levy Measure (November 2024)

“To provide educational excellence for student learning by ensuring competitive salaries to retain and recruit high quality teachers and staff, implementing and preserving academic programs, and distributing proportional funds pursuant to Florida law with charter schools, shall the School District of Hillsborough County levy an ad valorem operating millage of one mill annually from July 1, 2025 through June 30, 2029, with annual reporting to county residents for transparency of the use of funds?”
## Tampa, Florida, Remove Residency Requirements for Non-Elected City Officers Measure (November 2024)

“Shall the amendment to section 6.01 of the Tampa Charter, revising the residency requirements for the officers of the city who conduct the government to apply only to elected officers, as set out and proposed by City of Tampa Ordinance No. 2024-59, be ratified and approved?”
